design_audit.selection_story: The paper's central finding is that immigrant-founded firms have heavier-tailed firm size distributions (flatter power law slopes) than native-founded firms. The aggregated admin data from the Census reports log-frequency vs log-firm-size by immigrant status. The linear fit of this log-log relationship is the power law slope. The pooled regression with an immigrant interaction captures the slope difference directly as a regression coefficient.
design_audit.notes: Uses disclosure-approved aggregated Census administrative data (firm size frequency distributions). The immigrant coefficient captures the level difference in firm-formation rates; the interaction captures the slope difference (heavier tail). N=14 observations (7 firm-size bins x 2 groups). Defn1: immigrant startup = at least 1 foreign-born founder.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log normalized firm-formation frequency (log10 of firm count / population size)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Difference in power law intercept (level) and slope (tail heaviness) between immigrant- and native-founded startup size distributions
claim_object.target_population: All startups 2005-2010 (Census W-2 administrative data, aggregated)

baseline_specs.label: Admin-Defn1-Pooled
baseline_specs.notes: Pooled regression replicating Figure 1 lfit lines. Treatment effect is the immigrant level shift; interaction is the slope difference.

constraints.notes: Aggregated data with small N (7 bins x 2 groups = 14 obs). Robust SEs may not be reliable but are used for consistency.

variants.notes: Classical OLS SEs (small N, HC1 may over-reject)

design_audit.selection_story: Fortune 500 firm-level analysis: comparing employee counts of immigrant- vs native-founded Fortune 500 firms. This is a firm-level cross-sectional regression using the publicly available hand-collected Fortune 500 dataset.
design_audit.notes: Fortune 500 hand-collected data (N=449 firms). Immigrant = at least 1 foreign-born founder (defn1). Merged with decade-level immigrant population data.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log number of employees at Fortune 500 firms
claim_object.estimand_concept: Employee count gap between immigrant- and native-founded Fortune 500 firms, conditional on observables
